descript.abstract: Layer identifies the locations of airports throughout the state of St Vincent and The Grenadines. The attribute table was completed using data provided by the St Vincent and The Grenadines Airport Authority statistics used from the year 2011 (data was provided for the years between 1994 to 2011; however, the editor used the most recent year). Staff data for Mustique Airport was not provided.
descript.purpose: Resource developed to locate and understand the capacity of the airport infrastructure. This information will help inform the Nature Conservancy's AWE project.Scientists around the world agree that climate change is indisputable. Impacts, including rising sea levels, increased storm intensity, warming temperatures and acidifying waters, dying coral reefs, shifting fish stocks, and incidence of flooding and drought, are already being felt, and are expected to continue and increase for decades to come. Nature holds some of the world’s best and most practical solutions to climate change, solutions that keep nature and people healthy, safe, and secure. The goal of At the Water’s Edge (AWE) is to demonstrate that governments and people in vulnerable coastal communities in Grenada and St. Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG) can enhance their resilience to climate change by protecting, restoring and effectively managing their marine and coastal ecosystems (also known as ecosystem-based adaptation or EBA) and strengthening local capacity for adaptation.

Census Division Code - Unique 2 digit CD identifier
